subprocess_flow.description: The Inventory Management Team reviews the verified stock-out documentation to understand the initial circumstances surrounding the stock-out.
success_criteria: The Inventory Management Team has reviewed the stock-out documentation.

subprocess_flow.description: The team analyzes recent sales data for the product to identify any unusual trends or spikes in demand that may have contributed to the stock-out.
success_criteria: Sales data for the product has been analyzed for recent trends.

subprocess_flow.description: The team reviews past orders for the product to check for any delays, discrepancies, or unusual order patterns.
success_criteria: Past orders for the product have been reviewed for any issues.

subprocess_flow.description: The team checks inventory records for discrepancies, errors, or inconsistencies that may have led to the stock-out.
success_criteria: Inventory records have been thoroughly checked for errors.

subprocess_flow.description: The team investigates potential supply chain issues, such as delays in delivery, supplier shortages, or transportation problems.
success_criteria: Potential supply chain issues have been investigated.

subprocess_flow.description: The team uses the standardized checklist and decision tree to guide the root cause analysis process and ensure all relevant factors are considered.
success_criteria: The standardized checklist and decision tree have been consulted.

subprocess_flow.description: Based on the analysis and checklist, the team identifies the primary root cause of the stock-out.
success_criteria: The primary root cause of the stock-out has been identified.

subprocess_flow.description: The team documents the entire root cause analysis process, including the identified root cause, supporting evidence, and any shortfalls or errors encountered during the analysis.
success_criteria: The root cause analysis report is complete and accurate.
